greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest such sequence a that a(i) = a(j) => A046523(A322863(i)) = A046523(A322863(j)) for all i, j.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A046523(A322863(n)).
Equally, restricted growth sequence transform of A278222(A322865(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 30 2018
